question: The __________ was a belief by the Japanese to justify their conquest and gain control of other Asian countries to establish unity in culture, economy, and politics.
The _________ was established by the Americans to counter any foreign invasion, particularly the Japanese.
The surprise attack at __________ on December 7, 1941, was to cripple the American Pacific Fleet, making it harder for Americans to send reinforcements in Asia.
The ________ marked the surrender of the American and Filipino troops, but local resistance persisted.
_______ was a group of Filipinos who collaborated with the Japanese by identifying members of the resistance as well as those who helped the guerillas.
The _________ was a guerilla group established in Central Luzon and Southern Tagalog, which became one of the most effective resistance groups against the Japanese.
Surrendering Filipino and American troops were forced to march from ________ to ________, which became known to us as the “Death March”.
Filipino women were forced to become ________ for the Japanese soldiers.
Pres. Roosevelt agreed to grant the Philippines independence as long as it were a _________ and that the United States was allowed to establish ________ in the country.
Gen. Douglas MacArthur __________ Huk leaders Luis Taruc and Casto Alejandrino.
